I think it makes her a lot less clunky (though not totally better) than she was.

what akali needs is a way to amplify her auto attacks. 
something like: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/FKazxyxF-bruiser-crit-modifier-crit-base-damage-on-select-items

such that she could build like {{item:3078}} {{item:3142}}  and reach about 50% crit chance with just two items. 
or preferably even have flattened crit (like ashe) or half and half. 
Half and half is where 50% of your crit damage is flattened/incorporated into each of your autos and the remaining 50% applies when you crit. Say your total attack damage is 100. if you crit you deal 200.  At 25% crit chance, 100/4 = 25. flattening crit would mean giving you 125 per auto. This would instead give you 25/2 = 12.5 so 12.5 per auto and the rest... 25+12.5 = 37.5 when you crit. so autos would deal 112.5 and crits 137.5 but preferably also with more crit chance as stated above (however it would have to be less/medium sized crit as opposed to the full fledged crit we're familiar with something closer to a 150% but in turn you get to have more crit chance). 

That way she isn't so reliant on chance to do damage with her auto since she doesn't have much time to get her autos in between all the cc on her.

a full build would look like: {{item:3078}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3146}}{{item:3157}} {{item:3065}}  {{item:3111}}

My reasoning is that she's an energy champion, the thing is while her e and w do indeed cost a lot, you can sort of live without them since her q is on short enough cool down and ult charges can be up pretty often. 
Although still I do think energychamps/ninjas should somewhat benefit or revolve around auto attacks which so far seems to be the case with{{champion:98}} ,{{champion:85}} , and {{champion:238}} .
For those extended fights where there might be some down time while you wait for your energy bar to restore. 

her ad scaling isn't that great and anytime you get ad its always a good idea to get some attack speed to complement it and maintain the optimal damage ratio between both, unless you can really cast spells or apply hydra active like say for{{champion:80}}, {{champion:92}}, {{champion:91}}, but even they often benefit from the as on ghostblade's active tremendously in some instances. 

Not to mention akali's passive is similar to having a built in devourer/nashor's tooth in that it gives each of your auto attacks addtional ap damage ranging from 50 to 100+ depending on how much ap you have. {{item:3124}} isn't all that bad on her. A slight buff/rework to rageblade might help akali a lot. 

It would not be the crit we're familiar with at the moment. it would resemble that of the new {{champion:22}} a lot. By flattening crit you don't have to rely on so much on chance. Right now in the fast pace nature of this game there are short windows in which you have to deal damage. Relying on 25% crit does not cut it. 
a damage amplifier would help a lot with that.

I think a large problem with akali is that once she jumps you, you have one option, kill her before she kills you, no escape is not an option, and if you do out-damage her, just hope to god she dosen't shroud.
Another thing I hate is her spellvamp, like seriously? its not enough she has good base stats and mr per lv? she needs to be able to heal off harass too? especially since her q is single target and heals for a decent bit every time, what is it with riot lumping sustain onto manaless champs?...
